description: From Middle English ache, borrowed from Old French ache, from Vulgar Latin *acca. (Compare Italian acca.) The source is unclear, but may descend from the vowelless alphabetic sequence ha ka 'H, K' (becoming [aka] when the [h] ceased to be pronounced), as K had low frequency in Late Latin.

entries.meaning: The name of the Latin-script letter H.
examples: The word length, which contains only four sounds l e ng th, is usually spell'd thus, el ee en gee tee aitch.
